intro: Tabernaemontana hystrix, commonly known as the spiked tabernanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features a woody stem with smooth, glossy leaves that are typically ovate in shape. It produces long, spiny seed pods that contain numerous small, toxic seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
